function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Conducting multiple regression models may lead to the risk of overfitting and misleading results due to the large number of predictor variables.","Impact":"Misinterpretation of green space-infection associations, leading to ineffective public health interventions.","Mitigation":"Use regularization techniques (e.g., Lasso, Ridge) to prevent overfitting, and validate models with independent datasets.","Technologies":"Regularization algorithms, cross-validation techniques, independent validation datasets.","People":"Researchers, public health officials","Owner":"Research institutions, public health organizations"},{"Description":"Assessing the association of forest with infection rates across different time periods and urbanicity levels may overlook other important factors contributing to disease propagation.","Impact":"Incomplete understanding of the factors influencing infection rates, leading to ineffective mitigation strategies.","Mitigation":"Conduct comprehensive risk factor assessments that account for a wide range of variables, including socioeconomic factors, healthcare access, and community behavior.","Technologies":"Comprehensive risk assessment frameworks, data integration and analysis tools.","People":"Researchers, epidemiologists","Owner":"Public health agencies, research institutions"},{"Description":"Examining the optimal distance from forest for its association with infection rates may neglect the impact of other environmental and social determinants of health in disease transmission.","Impact":"Failure to consider other relevant factors, leading to incomplete risk mitigation strategies.","Mitigation":"Incorporate broader environmental and social determinants of health into the analysis, such as air quality, population density, and community mobility.","Technologies":"Geospatial analysis tools, environmental exposure modeling, social and environmental health data integration.","People":"Data scientists, public health experts","Owner":"Environmental health agencies, public health organizations"}]}
